verses.kjv: And it came to pass after many days, that the word of the LORD came to Elijah in the third year, saying, Go, shew thyself unto Ahab; and I will send rain upon the earth.
verses.ct: After a long time — in the 3rd year — the LORD spoke to Elijah: "Go and present yourself to Ahab, and I will send rain on the land."

verses.kjv: And Elijah went to shew himself unto Ahab. And there was a sore famine in Samaria.
verses.ct: So Elijah set out to present himself to Ahab. The famine in Samaria had become severe.

verses.kjv: And Ahab called Obadiah, which was the governor of his house. (Now Obadiah feared the LORD greatly:
verses.ct: Ahab summoned Obadiah, who managed his palace. (Obadiah was deeply devoted to the LORD.

verses.kjv: For it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the LORD, that Obadiah took an hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)
verses.ct: When Jezebel was killing off the LORD's prophets, Obadiah had taken 100 prophets and hidden them in 2 caves, 50 in each, and supplied them with bread and water.)

verses.kjv: And Ahab said unto Obadiah, Go into the land, unto all fountains of water, and unto all brooks: peradventure we may find grass to save the horses and mules alive, that we lose not all the beasts.
verses.ct: Ahab told Obadiah, "Search through the whole land — every spring and every stream. Maybe we can find enough grass to keep the horses and mules alive so we don't lose all our animals."

verses.kjv: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
verses.ct: They split up the territory between them to cover it all. Ahab went in one direction by himself, and Obadiah went in another direction by himself.

verses.kjv: And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, Art thou that my lord Elijah?
verses.ct: While Obadiah was on his way, Elijah suddenly appeared before him. Obadiah recognized him, dropped to the ground, and asked, "Is it really you, my master Elijah?"

verses.kjv: And he answered him, I am: go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
verses.ct: Elijah replied, "It is. Go tell your master, 'Elijah is here.'"

verses.kjv: And he said, What have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me?
verses.ct: Obadiah said, "What have I done wrong that you would hand your servant over to Ahab to be killed?"

verses.kjv: As the LORD thy God liveth, there is no nation or kingdom, whither my lord hath not sent to seek thee: and when they said, He is not there; he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they found thee not.
verses.ct: As surely as the LORD your God lives, there isn't a single nation or kingdom where my master hasn't sent people looking for you. Whenever they said, 'He's not here,' Ahab made that kingdom or nation swear an oath that they hadn't found you.

verses.kjv: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
verses.ct: And now you're telling me, 'Go tell your master that Elijah is here.'

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that the Spirit of the LORD shall carry thee whither I know not; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he cannot find thee, he shall slay me: but I thy servant fear the LORD from my youth.
verses.ct: The moment I leave you, the Spirit of the LORD will carry you off to who knows where. When I go tell Ahab and he can't find you, he'll kill me! Yet I, your servant, have been wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD since I was young.

verses.kjv: Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of the LORD, how I hid an hundred men of the LORD’s prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water?
verses.ct: Hasn't my master been told what I did when Jezebel was killing the LORD's prophets? I hid 100 of the LORD's prophets in 2 caves, 50 in each, and provided them with bread and water.

verses.kjv: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here: and he shall slay me.
verses.ct: Now you're saying, 'Go tell your master that Elijah is here.' He will kill me!"

verses.kjv: And Elijah said, As the LORD of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, I will surely shew myself unto him to day.
verses.ct: Elijah said, "As surely as the LORD of Hosts lives, the one I serve, I will present myself to Ahab today."

verses.kjv: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him: and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
verses.ct: So Obadiah went to find Ahab and gave him the message. Then Ahab went to meet Elijah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said unto him, Art thou he that troubleth Israel?
verses.ct: When Ahab saw Elijah, he said to him, "So there you are — the man who has brought disaster on Israel!"

verses.kjv: And he answered, I have not troubled Israel; but thou, and thy father’s house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of the LORD, and thou hast followed Baalim.
verses.ct: Elijah responded, "I haven't brought disaster on Israel. You have — you and your father's family — by abandoning the LORD's commands and following the Baals.

verses.kjv: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel unto mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty, and the prophets of the groves four hundred, which eat at Jezebel’s table.
verses.ct: Now send word and assemble all of Israel at Mount Carmel, along with the 450 prophets of Baal and the 400 prophets of Asherah who eat at Jezebel's table."

verses.kjv: So Ahab sent unto all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together unto mount Carmel.
verses.ct: So Ahab sent messengers throughout all of Israel and gathered the prophets at Mount Carmel.

verses.kjv: And Elijah came unto all the people, and said, How long halt ye between two opinions? if the LORD be God, follow him: but if Baal, then follow him. And the people answered him not a word.
verses.ct: Elijah stood before all the people and said, "How long are you going to waver between two choices? If the LORD is God, follow him. But if Baal is God, follow him." The people said nothing.

verses.kjv: Then said Elijah unto the people, I, even I only, remain a prophet of the LORD; but Baal’s prophets are four hundred and fifty men.
verses.ct: Then Elijah said to the people, "I am the only remaining prophet of the LORD, but Baal has 450 prophets.

verses.kjv: Let them therefore give us two bullocks; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under: and I will dress the other bullock, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under:
verses.ct: Bring us 2 bulls. Let them pick one bull for themselves, cut it into pieces, and place it on the wood — but don't light a fire. I'll prepare the other bull, place it on the wood, and also not light a fire.

verses.kjv: And call ye on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the LORD: and the God that answereth by fire, let him be God. And all the people answered and said, It is well spoken.
verses.ct: Then you call on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of the LORD. The god who answers with fire — he is the true God." All the people responded, "That's a fair proposal."

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress it first; for ye are many; and call on the name of your gods, but put no fire under.
verses.ct: Elijah told the prophets of Baal, "Pick one of the bulls and prepare it first, since there are so many of you. Call on the name of your god, but don't light any fire."

verses.kjv: And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any that answered. And they leaped upon the altar which was made.
verses.ct: So they took the bull that was given to them, prepared it, and called on Baal's name from morning until noon, crying out, "Baal, answer us!" But there was no response — no voice, no answer. They danced wildly around the altar they had built.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, Cry aloud: for he is a god; either he is talking, or he is pursuing, or he is in a journey, or peradventure he sleepeth, and must be awaked.
verses.ct: At noon, Elijah started taunting them. "Shout louder!" he said. "After all, he's a god! Maybe he's deep in thought, or busy, or traveling. Or perhaps he's sleeping and needs to be woken up!"

verses.kjv: And they cried aloud, and cut themselves after their manner with knives and lancets, till the blood gushed out upon them.
verses.ct: So they shouted even louder and slashed themselves with swords and spears, as was their custom, until blood flowed over them.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when midday was past, and they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded.
verses.ct: After midday passed, they continued their frantic prophesying until the time of the evening sacrifice. But still there was no response — no voice, no answer, no sign of attention.

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto all the people, Come near unto me. And all the people came near unto him. And he repaired the altar of the LORD that was broken down.
verses.ct: Then Elijah said to all the people, "Come closer to me." They all gathered around him, and he rebuilt the altar of the LORD that had been torn down.

verses.kjv: And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, unto whom the word of the LORD came, saying, Israel shall be thy name:
verses.ct: Elijah took 12 stones, one for each tribe descended from Jacob, the man to whom the LORD had said, "Your name will be Israel."

verses.kjv: And with the stones he built an altar in the name of the LORD: and he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed.
verses.ct: With these stones he constructed an altar dedicated to the LORD. Then he dug a trench around the altar large enough to hold about 4 gallons of seed.

verses.kjv: And he put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid him on the wood, and said, Fill four barrels with water, and pour it on the burnt sacrifice, and on the wood.
verses.ct: He arranged the wood, cut the bull into pieces, and placed it on the wood. Then he said, "Fill 4 large jars with water and pour it over the offering and the wood."

verses.kjv: And he said, Do it the second time. And they did it the second time. And he said, Do it the third time. And they did it the third time.
verses.ct: He said, "Do it a 2nd time." So they did it again. He said, "Do it a 3rd time." So they did it a 3rd time.

verses.kjv: And the water ran round about the altar; and he filled the trench also with water.
verses.ct: Water flowed all around the altar and even filled the trench completely.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that thou art God in Israel, and that I am thy servant, and that I have done all these things at thy word.
verses.ct: At the time of the evening sacrifice, the prophet Elijah stepped forward and prayed, "LORD, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, let it be known today that you are God in Israel, that I am your servant, and that I have done all of this because you directed me to.

verses.kjv: Hear me, O LORD, hear me, that this people may know that thou art the LORD God, and that thou hast turned their heart back again.
verses.ct: Answer me, LORD, answer me, so that these people will recognize that you, LORD, are God, and that you are turning their hearts back to you."

verses.kjv: Then the fire of the LORD fell, and consumed the burnt sacrifice, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.
verses.ct: Then fire from the LORD fell from above and consumed the offering, the wood, the stones, the dirt, and even evaporated the water in the trench.

verses.kjv: And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces: and they said, The LORD, he is the God; the LORD, he is the God.
verses.ct: When all the people witnessed this, they dropped to the ground and cried out, "The LORD — he is God! The LORD — he is God!"

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto them, Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape. And they took them: and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there.
verses.ct: Elijah commanded them, "Seize the prophets of Baal! Don't let a single one get away!" They captured them, and Elijah brought them down to the Kishon Valley, where he killed them.

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto Ahab, Get thee up, eat and drink; for there is a sound of abundance of rain.
verses.ct: Then Elijah told Ahab, "Go eat and drink, because the sound of heavy rain is coming."

verses.kjv: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he cast himself down upon the earth, and put his face between his knees,
verses.ct: So Ahab went off to eat and drink. Meanwhile, Elijah climbed to the summit of Carmel, bent down to the ground, and pressed his face between his knees.

verses.kjv: And said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up, and looked, and said, There is nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.
verses.ct: He told his servant, "Go and look out toward the sea." The servant went, looked, and came back saying, "There's nothing." Elijah said, "Go back 7 times."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the seventh time, that he said, Behold, there ariseth a little cloud out of the sea, like a man’s hand. And he said, Go up, say unto Ahab, Prepare thy chariot, and get thee down, that the rain stop thee not.
verses.ct: On the 7th time, the servant reported, "Look — a small cloud about the size of a man's fist is rising from the sea." Elijah said, "Go tell Ahab, 'Hitch up your chariot and head down before the rain stops you.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the mean while, that the heaven was black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.
verses.ct: Before long, the heavens turned dark with clouds and wind, and a tremendous downpour began. Ahab rode his chariot toward Jezreel.

verses.kjv: And the hand of the LORD was on Elijah; and he girded up his loins, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
verses.ct: The power of the LORD came upon Elijah. He prepared himself, and ran ahead of Ahab all the way to the entrance of Jezreel.
